document.masterDocTitle: Review of Dissomphalus Ashmead (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae) from Panama, with key to the Central American species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of Dissomphalus Ashmead (Hymenoptera, Bethylidae) from Panama, with key to the Central American species

heading.emphasis:
Dissomphalus teobus Brito & Azevedo
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. Tergal process with pit of tubercle with few setae.

Remarks. This species is easily recognized by having the paramere wide basally and the triangular shape of the outer lobe of the aedeagal dorsal body which is very projected forward. This species is not similar to anyone of the setosus species-group.

Material examined.
